meanings.sent1: After escaping, the evil sorcerer vowed to reenslave the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The villain's plan was to reenslave the captured warriors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wizard tried to reenslave the talking animals for his circus.
meanings.sent4: The dark magic threatened to reenslave the kingdom in eternal darkness.
meanings.sent5: The hero's mission was to prevent the sorcerer from reenslaving the innocent townsfolk.

meanings.definition: To make someone a slave again
meanings.sent1: The cruel ruler sought to reenslave those who had gained freedom.
meanings.sent2: The conquerors aimed to reenslave the liberated prisoners.
meanings.sent3: The greedy merchant tried to reenslave the workers by cutting their wages.
meanings.sent4: The chains of poverty threatened to reenslave the struggling family.
meanings.sent5: The tyrant's ultimate goal was to reenslave the entire population under his rule.

meanings.definition: To force someone back into slavery
meanings.sent1: The warlord's army would reenslave any who dared to resist.
meanings.sent2: The oppressive regime aimed to reenslave those who sought freedom.
meanings.sent3: The wicked enchantress tried to reenslave the prince with a cursed spell.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of fear threatened to reenslave the once liberated souls.
meanings.sent5: The chains of hatred were ready to reenslave the hearts of the divided kingdom.
